text: UPDATED: MAY 30, 2017 Bottle #354 I think..it kinda rubbed off. Golden straw pour. Amazing apple and honey aroma. Balance is perfect. Flavor follows suit. Actually more honey forward than I expected, with apples cutting it perfectly with a light juicy tartness. Flawless for my tastes. An incredible mead. Ken truly is a magician.

Batch 1 bottle received in trade. Clear pale golden pour leaving some nice looking legs on the glass with a swirl. Intensely complex, almost ice cider like, apple nose with light supporting floral honey. Sweet, tiny sour & heavy fruity taste. Intense yet mellow & balanced. Soft, round, tiny tart & slightly oily mouthfeel. Incredibly balanced & delicious.

April 29, 2017. Bottle at Schramms Balcony Bonanza (indoor edition). 

Clear golden with nice oily legs. Very nicr blend of sweet floral honey and juicy baked red apples, some light apple skin notes and herbal notes, a touch of vanilla. Sweet fruity and light floral. Smooth oily texture. Slight tart finish with lots of juicy apples and sweet honey.

Bottle shared at schramms balcony bonanza. Deep golden dark colour. Nose is loaded with fresh apples, such a difference compared to the regular Apple. Mix of green and sweet red apples, thick sweet Apple juice, earthy, honey sweetness in the back. Loaded Apple aftertaste. Such a difference compared to the regular. Thick smooth mouthfeel
A: Clear deep yellow coloured N: Honey, red apple, green apple T: Honey, sweet red apples O: Wow! Perfect balanced!
Sample at Schramms on 4/2/17. Pours clear gold with some legs. Aroma of tart apple juice and sweet honey. Sweet honey flavor with a light apple finish that has some mild tartness.

375 mL bottle. Bottle 97 of 516, waxed and signed, which is apparently how you can tell its Apple Reserve. Honey aroma is surprisingly strong. A little bit of apple. Tastes more like a cider here. Sweet apple and honey up front. Apple becomes sharp and acidic in the back end, cutting the sweetness. Smell and initial taste is honey and then apple takes over. Very nice.
Bottle 97/516 signed by Ken Schramm - Pours golden yellow. Nose is apples, honey. Taste is lots of apples upfront backed up with sweetness. Very decadent. Slight tartness. And damn good!!!
Everything thats great about the regular Apple release, just amplified and in a purer form, if that makes sense. Superb.
This is ridiculous. Alcoholic apple juice. Honey is in perfect balance with the fruit, as usual.
Love this mead. I had a chance to try all Apple variations and they were all killer. Hopefully they bottle most of those variations.

Leftovers from the Anniversary Party. Pour at the Meadery. The pour is a clear light good with a bubbly collar. The aroma is a little hot. There is a nice cider quality in front of the honey, and then its definitely a bit of booze on the back end. The flavor is just as good. The sweetness of the honey is up front and then the apples come rolling in. The skins, the flesh, each in different waves. The dryness is nice on the back end. The mouth feel is light and slick with a great cider quality. The honey is linger on the finish, and it winds up like a pressed cider. This is good.

Sampled at Schramms where it pours up with a clear pure gold body that supports a tiny ring of bubbles and tosses up like sheet legginess. The aroma offers up plenty of apple as well as a waxy earthy apple note and some honeycomb mixed with a faint booziness at the end of the draw. The taste is silky smooth and sweet and brings up an apple sweet honey richness that forces you to savor it for as long as possible. To midway some honeycomb like wax and fresh apple earthiness joins in and takes this to the finish. Just yummers. This would be great in pancakes or ice cream.

Tap at Schramms. Aroma is sweet apple syrup and light pear. Tastes moderately sweet. Smooth boozy apple cider. Great stuff but doesnt seem different than the regular apple. Would love to try this side by side with the regular.
